semantic_title: HIV Disease or HIV Positive Status Managed by Antiretroviral Medication Coding Guidelines
section_path: Section I > C. Chapter-Specific Coding Guidelines > 1. Chapter 1: Certain Infectious and Parasitic Diseases > a. Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) Infections > j. HIV disease or HIV positive status managed by antiretroviral medication

content.full_text: If a patient with documented HIV disease, HIV-related illness or AIDS is currently managed on antiretroviral medications, assign code B20, Human immunodeficiency virus [HIV] disease. If a patient with documented HIV positive status is currently managed on antiretroviral medication, assign code Z21, Asymptomatic human immunodeficiency virus [HIV] infection status, in the absence of any additional documentation of HIV disease, HIV-related illness or AIDS. Code Z79.899, Other long term (current) drug therapy, may be assigned as an additional code to identify the long-term (current) use of antiretroviral medications. (Evidence: pg no: 22, L36-L43)
content.summary: Guidelines for coding HIV patients managed with antiretroviral medications, distinguishing between HIV disease and HIV positive status (Evidence: pg no: 22, L36-L43)
key_concepts: HIV disease with antiretroviral management (Evidence: pg no: 22, L38-L40)
HIV positive status with antiretroviral management (Evidence: pg no: 22, L41)

detailed_rules.rule_text: If a patient with documented HIV disease, HIV-related illness or AIDS is currently managed on antiretroviral medications, assign code B20 (Evidence: pg no: 22, L38-L40)
detailed_rules.explanation: For patients with documented HIV disease, HIV-related illness, or AIDS who are on antiretroviral therapy, always use B20 regardless of current symptom status (Evidence: pg no: 22, L38-L40)
common_applications: HIV patients with history of opportunistic infections on ARV therapy

detailed_rules.rule_text: If a patient with documented HIV positive status is currently managed on antiretroviral medication, assign code Z21 in the absence of any additional documentation of HIV disease, HIV-related illness or AIDS (Evidence: pg no: 22, L41)
detailed_rules.explanation: For HIV positive patients on antiretroviral therapy without documented HIV disease or related illness, use Z21 for asymptomatic status (Evidence: pg no: 22, L41)
common_applications: HIV positive patients on PrEP or treatment without documented illness
Asymptomatic HIV patients on antiretroviral therapy

detailed_rules.rule_text: Code Z79.899, Other long term (current) drug therapy, may be assigned as an additional code to identify the long-term (current) use of antiretroviral medications (Evidence: pg no: 22, L42-L43)
detailed_rules.explanation: Optional additional code to specifically identify long-term antiretroviral medication use (Evidence: pg no: 22, L42-L43)
common_applications: Additional coding for antiretroviral therapy documentation

workflow_steps: Step 1: Determine if patient has documented HIV disease, HIV-related illness, or AIDS
Step 2: If yes, assign B20 regardless of antiretroviral therapy status
Step 3: If only HIV positive status without disease documentation, assign Z21
Step 4: Consider adding Z79.899 for long-term antiretroviral therapy documentation

Consider adding Z79.899 for comprehensive medication documentation (Evidence: pg no: 22, L42-L43)
